verses.verse: Yea <WH2063>, at this my heart <WH3820> trembleth <WH2729>, And is moved out <WH5425> of its place <WH4725>.
Hear <WH8085>, oh <WH8085>, hear the noise <WH7267> of his voice <WH7267>, And the sound <WH6963> that goeth out <WH3318> of his mouth <WH6310>.
He sendeth <WH3474> it <WH8281> forth under the whole heaven <WH8064>, And his lightning <WH216> unto the ends <WH3671> of the earth <WH776>.

After <WH310> it a voice <WH6963> roareth <WH7580>; He thundereth <WH7481> with the voice <WH6963> of his majesty <WH1347>; And he restraineth <WH6117> not the lightnings when his voice <WH6963> is heard <WH8085>.
God <WH410> thundereth <WH7481> marvellously <WH6381> with his voice <WH6963>; Great things <WH1419> doeth <WH6213> he <WH3045>, which we cannot comprehend.
For he saith <WH559> to the snow <WH7950>, Fall thou <WH1933> on the earth <WH776>; Likewise to the shower <WH4306> of rain <WH1653>, And to the showers <WH4306> of his mighty <WH5797> rain <WH1653>.
He sealeth up <WH2856> the hand <WH3027> of every man <WH120>, That all men <WH582> whom he hath made may know <WH3045> it <WH4639>.
Then the beasts <WH2416> go <WH935> into <WH1119> coverts <WH4585>, And remain <WH7931> in their dens <WH695>.
Out of the chamber of the south <WH2315> cometh <WH935> the storm <WH5492>, And cold <WH7135> out of the north <WH4215>.
By the breath <WH5397> of God <WH410> ice is given <WH5414>; And the breadth <WH7341> of the waters <WH4325> is straitened <WH4164>.
Yea <WH2959>, he ladeth the thick cloud <WH5645> with moisture <WH7377>; He spreadeth <WH6327> abroad the cloud <WH6051> of his lightning <WH216>:

And it is turned <WH2015> round about <WH4524> by his guidance <WH8458>, That they may do <WH6467> whatsoever he commandeth <WH6680> them Upon the face <WH6440> of the habitable <WH776> world <WH8398>,
Whether it be for correction <WH7626>, or for his land <WH776>, Or for lovingkindness <WH2617>, that he cause it to come <WH4672>.
Hearken <WH238> unto this <WH347>, O Job: Stand still <WH5975>, and consider <WH995> the wondrous <WH6381> works of God <WH410>.
Dost thou know <WH3045> how God <WH433> layeth <WH7760> his charge upon them <WH216>, And causeth the lightning of his cloud <WH6051> to shine <WH3313>?
Dost thou know <WH3045> the balancings <WH4657> of the clouds <WH5645>, The wondrous works <WH4652> of him who is perfect <WH8549> in knowledge <WH1843>?
How thy garments <WH899> are warm <WH2525>, When the earth <WH776> is still <WH8252> by reason of the south wind <WH1864>?
Canst thou with him spread out <WH7554> the sky <WH7834>, Which is strong <WH2389> as a molten <WH3332> mirror <WH7209>?
Teach <WH3045> us what we shall say <WH559> unto him <WH6186>; For we cannot set our speech in order by reason <WH6440> of darkness <WH2822>.
Shall it be told <WH5608> him that I would speak <WH1696>? Or should a man <WH376> wish <WH559> that he were swallowed up <WH1104>?
And now men see <WH7200> not the light <WH216> which is bright <WH925> in the skies <WH7834>; But the wind <WH7307> passeth <WH5674>, and cleareth them <WH2891>.
Out of the north <WH6828> cometh <WH857> golden splendor <WH2091>: God <WH433> hath upon him terrible <WH3372> majesty <WH1935>.

Touching the Almighty <WH7706>, we cannot find him out <WH4672>: He is excellent <WH7689> in power <WH3581>; And in justice <WH4941> and plenteous <WH7230> righteousness <WH6666> he will not afflict <WH6031>.
Men <WH582> do therefore fear <WH3372> him <WH7200>: He regardeth not any that are wise <WH2450> of heart <WH3820>.
